meanings.definition: The activity or occupation of keeping records of the financial affairs of a business.
meanings.sent1: Bookkeepings involve recording all the money transactions in a company.
meanings.sent2: She handles the bookkeepings for the small business down the street.
meanings.sent3: The bookkeepings of the store were so organized that even the tax auditor was impressed.
meanings.sent4: Her meticulous bookkeepings were like a map guiding the business through financial challenges.
meanings.sent5: Learning proper bookkeepings is essential for managing a successful business.

meanings.definition: The maintenance of a systematic record of transactions.
meanings.sent1: Accurate bookkeepings help in tracking all the sales and purchases.
meanings.sent2: The bookkeepings of the store were neatly arranged in folders.
meanings.sent3: The bookkeepings of the shop were so detailed that they could tell a story.
meanings.sent4: Her bookkeepings were like a well-organized library of financial information.
meanings.sent5: Good bookkeepings ensure transparency in business operations.
